did.unittitle: Cathedral Church of St. Paul (Detroit, Mich.) Records 1824-2002
did.abstract: The Cathedral Church of St. Paul was founded in Detroit in 1824 as St. Paulâ¿¿s parish. The record group spans the period from 1824 to 1995 and includes church registers of services, meeting minutes, and other documentation of the administrative life of the church. The record groups also includes record books of baptisms, marriages, and burials from 1824 to 1936.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The record group was deposited by Cathedral Church of St. Paul (donor no. 9205) on January 30, 2006.

accessrestrict.p: The record group is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright is not held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Cathedral Church of St. Paul (Detroit, Mich.) Records, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: St. Paul's parish was founded in 1824 in what was then the Territory of Michigan. Services were originally held in the Indian Council House on the corner of Jefferson Avenue and Randolph Street. The first church building, consecrated in 1828, was on Woodward Avenue, in the block of Congress and Larned. The church moved in 1851 to the corner of Congress at Shelby, just west of downtown.

The Cathedral Church of St. Paul at the corner of Woodward and Hancock was designed by Ralph Adams Cram (1863-1942) and construction began in 1908 and was completed in 1911. He chose to design the Cathedral in the 14th century English Style of Gothic architecture. The massive pillars which support the roof are more typical of Norman architecture, which preceded Gothic. The Cathedral is build according to medieval construction techniques with no steel superstructure. The Cathedral Church of St. Paul is an important landmark in Detroit and exemplary of the city's exceptional architectural heritage.

As the oldest Episcopal church in Michigan, St. Paul's has been instrumental both in the establishment of other Episcopal parishes, but also in the formation of the Diocese of Michigan, organized in 1832. Long before its official designation in 1906, St. Paul's has served as the "Cathedral Church." In 1958, the church changed its name from St. Paul's Cathedral to the Cathedral Church of St. Paul.

scopecontent.p: The Cathedral Church of St. Paul records span the period from 1824 to 1995 and includes church registers of services, meeting minutes, and other documentation of the administrative life of the church. The record groups also includes record books of baptisms, marriages, and burials from 1824 to 1936.

The record group consists of seven series: Church Registers; Administrative Records; Church Publications, Annual Reports/Annual Meeting Reports, Vestry Records, Topical Files, and Miscellaneous earlier records.

controlaccess.head: Subjects:
controlaccess.corpname: Cathedral Church of St. Paul (Detroit, Mich.)
controlaccess.subject: Registers of births, etc.--Michigan--Detroit.

scopecontent.p: The Church Registers series (approx. 3.0 linear feet and 14 oversize volumes) dates from 1824 to July 1995 documents church attendance and membership. It is divided into three subseries: Attendance Records (June 1924-July 1995); Baptisms; Marriages, Confirmations, and Burials (1824 to 1936), and Membership Lists/Family Records (1936-1940).
Membership Lists and Family Records is a series of five oversized volumes that largely overlap in alphabetical jurisdiction and dates covered.

The Administrative Records series (approx. 4 linear feet and 1 oversize volume) spans the dates 1824-1989, and documents the administrative functions of the church. It is divided into two subseries: Meeting Minutes and Financial Records. Meeting Minutes (1824-1989) documents church-wide meetings, including the Altar Guild, and includes founding documentation and the church's original constitution. Financial Records (1825-1929) documents pledges, donations, offerings and the day-to-day accounting of the cathedral.

did.unittitle: January 1987-December 1989 (includes Membership Lists and Memorial Funds Registry)

scopecontent.p: The Church Publications series (approx. 6.5 linear feet) spans the dates 1867-2000, and contains Cathedral Digest, The Calendar of St. Paul's Cathedral and St. Paul's Monthly Notice Paper. Also included in this series are bulletins from weekly services, special service calendars and catalogues, and yearbooks.

did.unittitle: The Calendar of St. Paul's Cathedral, 1895-1939
The Calendar of St. Paul's Cathedral, 1940-1961

scopecontent.p: The Annual Reports/Annual Meeting Reports series (0.5 linear feet) is a valuable source of ready information on the activities of the church. The series dates from 1954 to 2001.
The Vestry Records (3 linear feet) series includes minutes of meetings, reports, mailings, and other materials relating to the operation of the church. The series dates from 1964 to 1995.

The Topical Files series (8 linear feet) dates from 1950 to 2001 with the bulk of the material falling within the period of the 1980s and 90s. Arranged alphabetically, the series documents the management of the Cathedral facility, the involvement of the church in the mid-city neighborhood of Detroit, especially the University Cultural Center Area.

did.unittitle: Coalition for Human Needs of the Episcopal Church 1991
Diocese Convention to Elect Co-Adjutor May 1988
Disabilities, Task Force on Ministry to and with People with 1988-1989
Mid City Concerned Citizens District Council
Office for the Blessing of: Dean's House, Associate Rector's House undated
Pavilion Ground Breaking, G.M. and N.W. 1984
Philadelphia Office of the Episcopal Church 1990-1991
School of Theology, Board of Advisors 1980-1983

scopecontent.p: The Miscellaneous Earlier Records series (approx. 0.25 linear feet and 4 oversize volumes) spans the dates 1851-1943, and contains letters of transfer, newspaper clippings, and parochial records. Also included in this series is the score from "Pilgrimage, a parable with music" (2 vols.), and a set of scrapbooks (2 vols.).

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: The library also has a collection of The Cathedral News dated from 1948 to 1969. This newsletter is stored separated from the records of the Cathedral.
